intro: Psychotria subnubila, commonly known as the cloud forest psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes, thriving in the misty conditions of cloud forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a glossy surface, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. Psychotria subnubila is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in local communities.
